C,Citi lost more than $150 mln on currency swings - Bloomberg Jan 16 Citigroup Inc, the world's biggest currencies dealer, lost more than $150 million after the Swiss central bank decided to let the franc trade freely against the euro, Bloomberg reported. ~Fitch: Citi's 4Q'14 Results Cap Off a Disappointing Year (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO, January 16 (Fitch) Citigroup's (Citi) fourth quarter 2014 (4Q'14)  results reflect the ongoing drag of legal-related charges on the company, and  the difficult operating environment. Excluding the impact of CVA/DVA during all  periods, Citi's adjusted return on assets (ROA) was just 7 basis points (bps) in  4Q'14, and 40bps for the year, well below next year's targets of 90bps to  110bps. GS,Goldman Sachs touts commodities muscle as rivals shrink NEW YORK Goldman Sachs Group Inc  stuck with commodities trading while rivals have pulled back, and on Friday the bank felt vindicated. ~Goldman Sachs touts commodities muscle as rivals shrink NEW YORK, Jan 16 Goldman Sachs Group Inc  stuck with commodities trading while rivals have pulled back, and on Friday the bank felt vindicated. ~Fitch: FICC, Underwriting Weigh on Goldman's 4Q'14 Results (The following statement was released by the rating agency) NEW YORK, January 16 (Fitch) The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. (Goldman) reported  relatively weaker net revenue in 4Q'14, with declines in fixed income,  currencies and commodities (FICC) and underwriting outpacing strong performance  in financial advisory and equity sales and trading, according to Fitch Ratings. JNJ,J&J; Ebola vaccine gets 100 mln euros to speed development LONDON, Jan 16 Johnson & Johnson said on Friday that newly formed groups supporting work on its experimental Ebola vaccine would receive 100 million euros ($115 million) from Europe's Innovative Medicines Initiative to speed development. ~
LUK,UPDATE 5-FX broker FXCM gets rescue from Jefferies parent Leucadia NEW YORK, Jan 16 Retail foreign exchange broker FXCM Inc, reeling after customers lost more than $200 million from the surging Swiss franc, will get a $300 million loan from Leucadia National Corp to keep operating, the companies said in a statement Friday. ~WRAPUP 5-Swiss franc shock shuts some FX brokers; regulators move in LONDON, Jan 16 The Swiss franc shock reverberated through currency trading firms around the world on Friday, wiping out many small-scale investors and the brokerages that cater to them and forcing regulators to take a closer look at the sector. ~Leucadia to give FXCM $300 million to continue operations Leucadia National Corp  will give $300 million to retail foreign exchange broker FXCM Inc  to meet regulatory capital requirements, the two companies said on Friday. ~Leucadia to give FXCM $300 mln to continue operations Jan 16 Leucadia National Corp will give $300 million to retail foreign exchange broker FXCM Inc  to meet regulatory capital requirements, the two companies said on Friday. ~Leucadia National to provide FXCM with $300 million in financing: CNBC Leucadia National Corp , the parent of investment bank Jefferies, will provide foreign exchange brokerage FXCM Inc  with $300 million in financing, CNBC said on Friday. ~
MSFT.O,British police arrest man over Christmas Xbox, Playstation hacks LONDON, Jan 16 British police said on Friday they had arrested a man in northwest England following the 2014 cyber attacks on Sony PlayStation and Microsoft Xbox systems. ~
